bibl.title: Letter from Sidney Wallach to Philip Showalter Hench, March 24, 1950

div1.p: Wallach is grateful for Hench's suggestions. He feels that influential circles should exercise their power. Wallach would like to discuss Hench's proposals further.

div1.head: Letter from Sidney Wallach to Philip Showalter Hench, March 24, 1950
div1.opener:
Telephone: Murray Hill 4 -7770
SIDNEY WALLACH ASSOCIATES
Three Eighty One Fourth Avenue, New York 16, N. Y.
March 24, 1950
PUBLIC RELATIONS · MAGAZINE MANAGEMENT · CAMPAIGN PUBLICITY
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minnesota
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
It was very kind of your to write me as you did. And I am most
grateful to you for the special suggestions in that letter.

The nub of the problem is, however, that unless some influential
circles, medical and otherwise, exert themselves for such a measure,
it will die a borning. Should such an effort, however, be undertaken,
it will naturally lead to the utilization of just such projects as
you have in mind. I would, therefore, deeply appreciate hearing
from you as to how the proposal in one form or another can be
furthered.

If there is any likelihood of your being in this part of the
country, I would very much like to meet you and canvass the
possibilities fully.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Sidney Wallach SW:ap
P.S.: I believe that I read recently about your receiving a special
aware for your medical achievements. May I add my congratulations
to those that you have already received?
SIDNEY WALLACH
NATHAN CARD BELTH
IDALEE WALLACH
